I would go with the widget, if possible.
It's just HTML and JavaScript.
They're easy to write, and work well.
OS X, Vista, Windows 7, and Linux all have support for widgets and won't need additional software.
Windows XP would need a runtime (like Yahoo!
Widgets) to be installed first.
Each OS does things slightly differently, so changes would have to be made to make a widget run in Dashboard in OS X and as a Gadget in Windows Vista/7.
I hope this helps.
I made a widget to interact with a web application that company made.
I made is for OS X (my OS), and it was quite easy.
It just uses XMLHttpRequest to load some XML, parses it out, and updates it's self.
It's quite simple.
The same server side code can serve any kind of widget, as well as real applications.
